description: {"blocks":[{"key":"a6d0k","text":"Background: Mobilization of transposable elements (TEs) can generate large effect mutations. However, because new TE insertions are challenging to detect and transposition is typically rare, the actual rate and landscape of new insertions remains unexplored for most TEs. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"10adb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dresp","text":"Results: Here, we introduce a TE display sequencing approach that leverages target amplification of TE extremities to detect non-reference TE insertions with high sensitivity and specificity. By implementing this approach on serial dilutions of genomic DNA from A. thaliana lines carrying different repertoires of new TE insertions, we show that the method can detect TE insertions that are present at frequencies as low as 1:250 000 within a DNA sample. In addition, TE display sequencing can be multiplexed to simultaneously detect insertions for distinct TE families, including both retrotransposons and DNA transposons, increasing its versatility and cost-effectiveness to investigate complex “mobilomes”. Importantly, when combined with nanopore sequencing, this approach enables the identification of insertions using long-reads and achieves a turn around time from DNA extraction to insertion identification of less than 24h, significantly reducing the time-to-answer. Analysis of TE insertions in large populations of A. thaliana plants undergoing a transposition burst demonstrate the power of the multiplex TE display sequencing to assess the rates and allele frequencies of heritable insertions, enabling its implementation to study large-scale ‘evolve and resequence’ experiments. Furthermore, we show that ~6% of de novo TE insertions show recurrent allele frequency changes consistent with either positive or negative selection.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"edai2","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aebhd","text":"Conclusions: TE display sequencing is an ultra-sensitive, specific, quick, and cost-effective approach to investigate the rate and landscape of new insertions for multiple TEs in large scale population experiments. We provide a step-by-step experimental protocol as well as ready-to-use bioinformatic pipelines, ensuring straightforward implementation of the method. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

We recommend continuing with adapter ligation before stopping.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4uurc","text":"Vortex AMPure XP Beads to resuspend.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"324qk","text":"Add 7.5 μl (~ 0.16X) of resuspended beads to the 46.75 μl ligation reaction. Mix well by pipetting up and down at least 10 times. Be careful to expel all of the liquid out of the tip during the last mix. Vortexing for 3-5 seconds on high can also be used. If centrifuging samples after mixing, be sure to stop the centrifugation before the beads start to settle out.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1pjmq","text":" Incubate samples on bench top for at least 5 minutes at room temperature.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5glvu","text":"Place the tube on an appropriate magnetic stand to separate the beads from the supernatant. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9tmra","text":"After 5 minutes (or when the solution is clear), carefully transfer the supernatant containing your DNA to a new tube (Caution: do not discard the supernatant). Discard the beads that contain the unwanted large fragments. {"blocks":[{"key":"3lgof","text":"Add 7.5 μl (~0.16X) of resuspended Beads to the supernatant and mix at least 10 times. Be careful to expel all of the liquid from the tip during the last mix. Then incubate samples on the bench top for at least 5 minutes at room temperature.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2lb83","text":"Place the tube on an appropriate magnetic stand to separate the beads from the supernatant. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"67d15","text":"After 5 minutes (or when the solution is clear), carefully remove and discard the supernatant that contains unwanted DNA. Be careful not to disturb the beads that contain the desired DNA targets (Caution: do not discard beads).   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":196,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8a6m0","text":"Add 200 μl of 80% freshly prepared ethanol to the tube while in the magnetic stand. {"blocks":[{"key":"amtjf","text":"Repeat Step 19 once. Be sure to remove all visible liquid after the second wash. {"blocks":[{"key":"fcu4h","text":"Remove the tube from the magnetic stand. Elute the DNA target from the beads into 8μl of 10 mM Tris-HCl.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fllnu","text":"Add the following components to a sterile nuclease-free tube:    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5eq5c","text":"(green) NEBNext Ultra II End Prep Enzyme Mix           1.5 μl  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3o31d","text":"(green) NEBNext Ultra II End Prep Reaction Buffer    3.5 μl  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"59rlc","text":"Fragmented DNA (500ng)                                             25 μl  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d2577","text":"Total Volume                                                                   30 μl  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a8r7e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"44vfi","text":" Note: For End Prep and Ligation step, NEBNext® UltraTM II DNA Library Prep Kit's volume have been adjusted to reduce the price of each library. 48 samples can be processed with one kit (E7546S) instead of 24.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":53,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5dkpp","text":"Set a 100 μl or 200 μl pipette to 25 μl and then gently pipette the entire volume up and down at least 10 times to mix thoroughly. Perform a quick spin to collect all liquid from the sides of the tube.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cvlg1","text":"Note: It is important to mix well. The presence of a small amount of bubbles will not interfere with performance.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1jehm","text":"Place in a thermocycler, with the heated lid set to ≥ 75°C, and run the following program:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3s038","text":"30 minutes @20°C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b8if3","text":"30 minutes @ 65°C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4bl0j","text":"Hold at 4°C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fvmbo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"873sq","text":" If necessary, samples can be stored at -20°C; however, a slight loss in yield (~20%) may be observed. We recommend continuing with adapter ligation before stopping.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cf3d7","text":"Add the following components to a sterile nuclease-free tube:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bt7tg","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"brbru","text":"End Prep Reaction Mixture (Step 7 in End repair and A tailing Section)  30 μl  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"sfm6","text":"(red) NEBNext Ultra II Ligation Master Mix*                                              15 μl  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4hi3p","text":"(red) NEBNext Ligation Enhancer                                                             0.5 μl  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c7l33","text":"Custom Adapter (30µM)                                                                          1.25 μl ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aqkp4","text":"Total volume                                                                                           46.75 μl     ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bmfcr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5jmd8","text":"* Mix the Ultra II Ligation Master Mix by pipetting up and down several times prior to adding to the reaction.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bh22k","text":"Note: The Ligation Master Mix and Ligation Enhancer can be mixed ahead of time and is stable for at least 8 hours @ 4°C. We do not recommend adding adapter to a premix in the Adapter Ligation Step.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"al44h","text":"Set a 100 μl or 200 μl pipette to 40 μl and then pipette the entire volume up and down at least 10 times to mix thoroughly. Perform a quick spin to collect all liquid from the sides of the tube.      ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ejdr6","text":"Incubate at 20°C for 15 minutes in a thermocycler with the heated lid off.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2ibbf","text":"Vortex AMPure XP Beads to resuspend.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3j136","text":"Add 7.5 μl (~ 0.16X) of resuspended beads to the 46.75 μl ligation reaction. Mix well by pipetting up and down at least 10 times. Be careful to expel all of the liquid out of the tip during the last mix. Vortexing for 3-5 seconds on high can also be used. If centrifuging samples after mixing, be sure to stop the centrifugation before the beads start to settle out.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bkgdk","text":" Incubate samples on bench top for at least 5 minutes at room temperature.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9itpq","text":"Place the tube on an appropriate magnetic stand to separate the beads from the supernatant. If necessary, quickly spin the sample to collect the liquid from the sides of the tube before placing on the magnetic stand.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"21p8a","text":"After 5 minutes (or when the solution is clear), carefully transfer the supernatant containing your DNA to a new tube (Caution: do not discard the supernatant). Discard the beads that contain the unwanted large fragments.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":119,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cal49","text":"Add 7.5 μl (~0.16X) of resuspended Beads to the supernatant and mix at least 10 times. Be careful to expel all of the liquid from the tip during the last mix. Then incubate samples on the bench top for at least 5 minutes at room temperature.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fg0ns","text":"Place the tube on an appropriate magnetic stand to separate the beads from the supernatant. If necessary, quickly spin the sample to collect the liquid from the sides of the tube before placing on the magnetic stand.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7ubb2","text":"After 5 minutes (or when the solution is clear), carefully remove and discard the supernatant that contains unwanted DNA. Be careful not to disturb the beads that contain the desired DNA targets (Caution: do not discard beads).   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":196,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f3dvk","text":"Add 200 μl of 80% freshly prepared ethanol to the tube while in the magnetic stand. Incubate at room temperature for 30 seconds, and then carefully remove and discard the supernatant. Be careful not to disturb the beads that contain DNA targets.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9v8cb","text":"Repeat Step 19 once. Be sure to remove all visible liquid after the second wash. If necessary, briefly spin the tube, place back on the magnet and remove traces of ethanol with a p10 pipette tip.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a5lor","text":"Air dry the beads for up to 5 minutes while the tube is on the magnetic stand with the lid open. Caution: Do not overdry the beads.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d7umf","text":"Remove the tube from the magnetic stand. Elute the DNA target from the beads into 8μl of 10 mM Tris-HCl.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4352p","text":" Mix well on a vortex mixer or by pipetting up and down 10 times. Incubate for at least 2 minutes at room temperature. If necessary, quickly spin the sample to collect the liquid from the sides of the tube before placing back on the magnetic stand.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"14ic3","text":"Place the tube on the magnetic stand. After 5 minutes (or when the solution is clear), transfer 7.5 μl to a new PCR tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1re8i","text":"Samples can be stored at -20°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d6v64","text":"Add the following components to a sterile strip tube:     ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e0fig","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"abrnq","text":"Adapter Ligated DNA Fragments (Step 24)                             7.5 μl  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"93eui","text":"(blue) NEBNext Ultra II Q5 Master Mix                                   12.5 μl ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8fnqj","text":"(blue) TEDseq_outer_for (10µM)                                              2.5 μl  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bfajr","text":"(blue) TE_outer_rev (10µM)                                                      2.5 μl  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eprb3","text":"Total volume                                                                               25 μl   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9svn3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fbr9n","text":"Set a 100 μl or 200 μl pipette to 20 μl and then pipette the entire volume up and down at least 10 times to mix thoroughly. Perform a quick spin to collect all liquid from the sides of the tube.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fs5o3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27eu4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1kjjf","text":" Place the tube on a thermocycler and perform PCR amplification using the following PCR cycling conditions:  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ur16","text":"1. 98°C 30”","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fpc3m","text":"2. 98°C 10”","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"brqve","text":"3. 61°C 75”","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fik9b","text":"4. GO TO .2 20x","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bmadl","text":"5. 61°C 5’","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"da6pf","text":"6. Hold at 4°C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"d2h0s","text":"Vortex AMPure XP to resuspend.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e78i6","text":"Place the tube on an appropriate magnetic stand to separate the beads from the supernatant. If necessary, quickly spin the sample to collect the liquid from the sides of the tube before placing on the magnetic stand.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"38u88","text":"Incubate samples on bench top for at least 5 minutes at room temperature.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5dkpp","text":"Add 17.5 μl (0.7X) resuspended beads to the PCR reaction. Mix well by pipetting up and down at least 10 times. Be careful to expel all of the liquid out of the tip during the last mix. Vortexing for 3-5 seconds on high can also be used. If centrifuging samples after mixing, be sure to stop the centrifugation before the beads start to settle out.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":13,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ouqf","text":"After 5 minutes (or when the solution is clear), carefully remove and discard the supernatant. Be careful not to disturb the beads that contain DNA targets (Caution: do not discard the beads).   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c7ucd","text":"Add 100 μl of 80% freshly prepared ethanol to the tube while in the magnetic stand. Incubate at room temperature for 30 seconds, and then carefully remove and discard the supernatant. Be careful not to disturb the beads that contain DNA targets.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fegkj","text":"Repeat Step 31 once for a total of two washes. Be sure to remove all visible liquid after the second wash. If necessary, briefly spin the tube, place back on the magnet and remove traces of ethanol with a p10 pipette tip.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5q248","text":"Air dry the beads for up to 5 minutes while the tube is on the magnetic stand with the lid open.  Caution: Do not over-dry the beads. This may result in lower recovery of DNA target. Elute the samples when the beads are still dark brown and glossy looking, but when all visible liquid has evaporated. When the beads turn lighter brown and start to crack they are too dry.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"acv0v","text":"Remove the tube from the magnetic stand. Elute the DNA target from the beads by adding 17µl of 10 mM Tris-HCl.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"emej4","text":"Mix well by pipetting up and down 10 times, or on a vortex mixer. Incubate for at least 2 minutes at room temperature. If necessary, quickly spin the sample to collect the liquid from the sides of the tube before placing back on the magnetic stand.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"adqbq","text":"Place the tube on the magnetic stand. After 5 minutes (or when the solution is clear), transfer 17 μl to a new PCR tube for and store at –20°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"o2gn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"48t5o","text":" Samples can be stored at -20°C.     ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
